page.title: 17A STOPSLEY SENIOR CITIZEN
page.content: The gentleman I interviewed lives in Stopsley and has done so for all his life. He is seventy years old, is not married and has no children, but he does have a golden labrador dog which he takes for a walk twice daily. He does his shopping locally in the 'village'. He is now retired, but until eight years ago, worked as a newspaper printer. He says the village has changed a lot during his lifetime. A lot more shops have been built and the roads widened. He says that although a great deal of progress has been made, he preferred the village as it used to be. There was a farm on the site of the present Jansell House and a village pond across the road where a garage now stands.
